title: Authors and Citation
text: Tinti Tomio G (2023). mrsim: Simulate Mendelian Randomization Data Using Meaningful Hyper Parameters. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mrsim: Simulate Mendelian Randomization Data Using Meaningful Hyper Parameters},   author = {Giuseppe {Tinti Tomio}},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Simulate Mendelian Randomization Data Using Meaningful Hyper Parameters
title: Simulate Mendelian Randomization Data Using Meaningful Hyper Parameters
text: goal mrsim simulate mendelian randomization (MR) data using meaningful hyper parameters.

title: Simulate Mendelian Randomization Data Using Meaningful Hyper Parameters
text: can install development version mrsim GitHub

title: Simulate Mendelian Randomization Data Using Meaningful Hyper Parameters
text: basic example shows use mrsim simulate MR data estimate causal effect exposure (X) outcome (Y) MendelianRandomization package.
code: # install.packages("MendelianRandomization") library(mrsim)  set.seed(42)  hyper_parameters <- define_hyper_parameters(     m = 500,     k = 500,     p = 25 / 100,     r2_g_x = 0.01 / 100,     r2_u_x = 30 / 100,     r2_u_y = 30 / 100,     beta_x_y = 20 / 100 )  print(hyper_parameters) #> # Hyper parameters #>  #> Number of non-zero effect G's (m): 500 #> Number of zero effect G's (k): 500 #> Minor allele frequency of G's (p): 0.25 #> Variance in X explained per G (r2_g_x): 1e-04 #> Variance in X explained by U (r2_u_x): 0.3 #> Variance in Y explained by U (r2_u_y): 0.3 #> Causal effect of X on Y (beta_x_y): 0.2 (targeted causal effect)  restrictions <- define_restrictions()  print(restrictions) #> # Restrictions #>  #> G mean (mean_g): 0 #> G variance (var_g): 1 #> U mean (mean_u): 0 #> U variance (var_u): 1 #> X mean (mean_x): 0 #> X variance (var_X): 1 #> Y mean (mean_y): 0 #> Y variance (var_Y): 1  parameters <- calculate_parameters(hyper_parameters, restrictions)  print(parameters) #> # Parameters #>  #> Number of non-zero effect G's (m): 500 #> Number of zero effect G's (k): 500 #> Minor allele frequency of G's (p): 0.25 #> U intercept (alpha_u): 0 #> U noise variance (sigma2_u): 1 #> X intercept (alpha_x): 0 #> Causal effect of G's on X (beta_g_x): [0.01, ..., 0] (1000 sized vector) #> Causal effect of U on X (beta_u_x): 0.5477226 #> X noise variance (sigma2_x): 0.65 #> Y intercept (alpha_y): 0 #> Causal effect of U on Y (beta_u_y): 0.438178 #> Causal effect of X on Y (beta_x_y): 0.2 (targeted causal effect) #> Y noise variance (sigma2_y): 0.672  sample <- generate_sample(parameters,n = 10e3)  print(sample) #> # Sample #>  #> Sample size (n): 10000 #>  #> ## Exogenous variables #>  #> Raw G data (gprime): [[1, ..., 0]] (10000 x 1000 sized matrix) #> U noise (e_u): [[-1.19680097216348, ..., -0.890468699587795]] (10000 x 1 sized matrix) #> X noise (e_x): [[0.460947832126287, ..., -2.41969073735133]] (10000 x 1 sized matrix) #> Y noise (e_y): [[0.527904124270486, ..., 0.388857577263968]] (10000 x 1 sized matrix) #>  #> ## Endogenous variables #>  #> G data (g): [[0.816496580927726, ..., -0.816496580927726]] (10000 x 1000 sized matrix) #> U data (u): [[-1.19680097216348, ..., -0.890468699587795]] (10000 x 1 sized matrix) #> X data (x): [[-0.545165772082768, ..., -2.1609379955708]] (10000 x 1 sized matrix) #> Y data (y): [[-0.20069246021126, ..., -0.503603077991844]] (10000 x 1 sized matrix)  summary_statistics <- calculate_summary_statistics(sample)  print(head(summary_statistics)) #>   snp     n     beta_g_x beta_se_g_x p_value_g_x f_statistic_g_x       r2_g_x #> 1   1 10000  0.010238784 0.009974030   0.3046599      1.05379325 1.053893e-04 #> 2   2 10000 -0.001569459 0.009940290   0.8745478      0.02492881 2.493374e-06 #> 3   3 10000 -0.007923938 0.010041294   0.4300517      0.62273429 6.228201e-05 #> 4   4 10000  0.006464692 0.009949239   0.5158574      0.42219769 4.222643e-05 #> 5   5 10000  0.003288470 0.009979881   0.7417772      0.10857682 1.085974e-05 #> 6   6 10000  0.009602536 0.010089301   0.3412446      0.90583630 9.059354e-05 #>        beta_g_y beta_se_g_y p_value_g_y f_statistic_g_y       r2_g_y #> 1 -0.0110235115 0.010005966  0.27062129      1.21372946 1.213825e-04 #> 2  0.0015893525 0.009972198  0.87337401      0.02540146 2.540648e-06 #> 3 -0.0007303149 0.010073837  0.94220848      0.00525570 5.256748e-07 #> 4  0.0078155899 0.009981081  0.43362190      0.61315236 6.132374e-05 #> 5 -0.0094842732 0.010011520  0.34349052      0.89744539 8.975444e-05 #> 6  0.0176732200 0.010120602  0.08079619      3.04943011 3.049110e-04  filtered_summary_statistics <- summary_statistics[summary_statistics$f_statistic_g_x > 10, ]  print(head(filtered_summary_statistics)) #>     snp     n   beta_g_x beta_se_g_x  p_value_g_x f_statistic_g_x      r2_g_x #> 15   15 10000 0.03241914 0.009957096 1.134168e-03        10.60077 0.001059166 #> 44   44 10000 0.03422637 0.009885209 5.376580e-04        11.98809 0.001197612 #> 228 228 10000 0.03357739 0.009982621 7.722630e-04        11.31370 0.001130317 #> 244 244 10000 0.03956636 0.009937673 6.898075e-05        15.85195 0.001583002 #> 257 257 10000 0.03805379 0.010059046 1.558269e-04        14.31141 0.001429381 #> 259 259 10000 0.03705894 0.009865990 1.734711e-04        14.10927 0.001409221 #>        beta_g_y beta_se_g_y p_value_g_y f_statistic_g_y       r2_g_y #> 15  0.010508500 0.009993799   0.2930535       1.1056565 1.105755e-04 #> 44  0.009588403 0.009922421   0.3338989       0.9338074 9.339069e-05 #> 228 0.009723977 0.010019857   0.3318355       0.9418132 9.419128e-05 #> 244 0.013624680 0.009976543   0.1720728       1.8650588 1.865084e-04 #> 257 0.005742709 0.010098391   0.5695891       0.3233920 3.234462e-05 #> 259 0.016103133 0.009903332   0.1039744       2.6439796 2.643809e-04  mr_data <- MendelianRandomization::mr_input(     bx = filtered_summary_statistics$beta_g_x,     bxse = filtered_summary_statistics$beta_se_g_x,     by = filtered_summary_statistics$beta_g_y,     byse = filtered_summary_statistics$beta_se_g_y )  model_fit <- MendelianRandomization::mr_ivw(mr_data)  estimated_beta_x_y <- model_fit@Estimate  print(estimated_beta_x_y) #> [1] 0.316981  real_beta_x_y <- get_beta_x_y(parameters)  print(real_beta_x_y) #> [1] 0.2

title: Calculate parameters — calculate_parameters
text: Calculate parameters simulating mendelian randomization (MR) data given hyper parameters restrictions.

title: Calculate parameters — calculate_parameters
text: hyper_parameters object class hyper_parameters restrictions object class restrictions

title: Calculate parameters — calculate_parameters
text: object class parameters

title: Calculate parameters — calculate_parameters
text: Additional constraints may posed parameters values order garantee simulated data valid.

title: Calculate summary statistics — calculate_summary_statistics
text: Calculate summary statistics sample mendelian randomization (MR) data.

title: Calculate summary statistics — calculate_summary_statistics
text: sample object class sample

title: Calculate summary statistics — calculate_summary_statistics
text: data frame m + k rows 12 columns

title: Calculate summary statistics — calculate_summary_statistics
text: summary statistics calculated SNP sample include following: beta_g_x: beta coefficient simple linear regression SNP g exposure x beta_se_g_x: standard error beta_g_x p_value_g_x: p-value beta_g_x f_statistic_g_x: F-statistic beta_g_x r2_g_x: R-squared simple linear regression SNP g exposure x beta_g_y: beta coefficient simple linear regression SNP g outcome y beta_se_g_y: standard error beta_g_y p_value_g_y: p-value beta_g_y f_statistic_g_y: F-statistic beta_g_y r2_g_y: R-squared simple linear regression SNP g outcome y

title: Define hyper parameters — define_hyper_parameters
text: Define hyper parameters simulating mendelian randomization (MR) data.

title: Define hyper parameters — define_hyper_parameters
code: define_hyper_parameters(m, k, p, r2_g_x, r2_u_x, r2_u_y, beta_x_y)

title: Define hyper parameters — define_hyper_parameters
text: m Number non-zero effect G's. positive integer k Number zero effect G's. positive integer p Minor allele frequency. 0 0.5 r2_g_x Variance X explained per G. 0 1 / m r2_u_x Variance X explained U. 0 1 r2_u_y Variance Y explained U. 0 1 beta_x_y (Targeted causal effect) Causal effect X Y. - 1 / sqrt(r2_g_x) 1 / sqrt(r2_g_x). Since variables standardized, reasonable range -1 1

title: Define hyper parameters — define_hyper_parameters
text: object class hyper_parameters

title: Define hyper parameters — define_hyper_parameters
text: Additional constraints may posed hyper parameter values order garantee simulated data valid.

title: Define parameters — define_parameters
text: Define parameters simulating mendelian randomization (MR) data.

title: Define parameters — define_parameters
code: define_parameters(   m,   k,   p,   alpha_u,   sigma2_u,   alpha_x,   beta_g_x,   beta_u_x,   sigma2_x,   alpha_y,   beta_u_y,   beta_x_y,   sigma2_y )

title: Define parameters — define_parameters
text: m Number non-zero effect G's. positive integer k Number zero effect G's. positive integer p Minor allele frequency. 0 0.5 alpha_u Intercept U. number sigma2_u Variance U noise. positive number alpha_x Intercept X. number beta_g_x Causal effect G's X. number beta_u_x Causal effect U X. number sigma2_x Variance X noise. positive number alpha_y Intercept Y. number beta_u_y Causal effect U Y. number beta_x_y (Targeted causal effect) Causal effect X Y. number sigma2_y Variance Y noise. positive number
